20110101070246.000|20110101070248.000|CC1|EVE WITH THE NEW YORK

20110101070253.000|20110101070255.000|CC1|AND THE ORCHESTRA WILL DELIGHT  
20110101070255.000|20110101070256.000|CC1|US WITH THE COMPLETE SECOND     
20110101070256.000|20110101070258.000|CC1|HALF OF TCHAIKOVSKY'S BALLET,   
20110101070258.000|20110101070302.000|CC1|THE "NUTCRACKER."               
20110101070302.000|20110101070304.000|CC1|FIRST, ALEC BALDWIN IS CHATTING 
20110101070304.000|20110101070306.000|CC1|WITH LANG LANG.                 
20110101070306.000|20110101070309.000|CC1|>> I DID NOT HAVE A CHANCE TO   
20110101070309.000|20110101070310.000|CC1|STAY OUT THERE AND PARTICIPATE  
20110101070310.000|20110101070312.000|CC1|IN THE OVATION AS LONG AS I     
20110101070312.000|20110101070313.000|CC1|WANTED TO BECAUSE I HAD TO DO   
20110101070313.000|20110101070316.000|CC1|THIS INTERVIEW, BUT I ABOUT TO  
20110101070316.000|20110101070316.000|CC1|YOU.                            
20110101070316.000|20110101070320.000|CC1|THAT WAS REMARKABLE.            
20110101070320.000|20110101070322.000|CC1|IT IS AMAZING THAT YOU PERFORMED
20110101070322.000|20110101070323.000|CC1|THAT CONCERTO WHEN MOST OF US   
20110101070323.000|20110101070325.000|CC1|WERE STILL LEARNING TRICKS ON   
20110101070325.000|20110101070326.000|CC1|OUR BIKES.                      
20110101070326.000|20110101070328.000|CC1|YOU WERE 13 WHEN HE FIRST PLAYED
20110101070328.000|20110101070329.000|CC1|IT IN PUBLIC.                   
20110101070329.000|20110101070330.000|CC1|WHAT IS DIFFERENT ABOUT THE WAY 
20110101070330.000|20110101070332.000|CC1|THAT YOU PLAY IT NOW?           
20110101070332.000|20110101070336.000|CC1|>> NOT A BIG DIFFERENCE, BUT IT 
20110101070336.000|20110101070337.000|CC1|SEEMS LIKE I UNDERSTAND THE     
20110101070337.000|20110101070344.000|CC1|PEACE MORE -- PIECE MORE,       
20110101070344.000|20110101070347.000|CC1|INTIMATELY.                     
20110101070347.000|20110101070349.000|CC1|NOW I AM 28 AND I HAVE MORE     
20110101070349.000|20110101070352.000|CC1|POWER TO PLAY THE PIECE.        
20110101070352.000|20110101070354.000|CC1|MORE IMPORTANT, TO HAVE TO      
20110101070354.000|20110101070358.000|CC1|CONTROL OF THE SOUND AND TO     
20110101070358.000|20110101070400.000|CC1|THINK ABOUT THE MUSIC LINES.    
20110101070400.000|20110101070403.000|CC1|I THINK MORE AND MORE I GREW UP,
20110101070403.000|20110101070405.000|CC1|THAT WILL GO DEEPER.            
20110101070405.000|20110101070407.000|CC1|>> THE FIRST AND SECOND         
20110101070407.000|20110101070409.000|CC1|MOVEMENTS ARE SO DIFFERENT, THEY
20110101070409.000|20110101070411.000|CC1|COULD HAVE ALMOST BEEN WRITTEN  
20110101070411.000|20110101070414.000|CC1|BY TWO DIFFERENT COMPOSERS.     
20110101070414.000|20110101070415.000|CC1|WHAT SHOULD COMPLETE THE FIRST  
20110101070415.000|20110101070417.000|CC1|MOVEMENT, OR EGO INTERNALLY WITH
20110101070417.000|20110101070418.000|CC1|THE SECOND?                     
20110101070418.000|20110101070422.000|CC1|>> THE FIRST IS VERY REALISTIC, 
20110101070422.000|20110101070423.000|CC1|ABOUT REVOLUTION, BAY, GRAND    
20110101070423.000|20110101070429.000|CC1|PRAIRIE -- BIG, GRAND.          
20110101070429.000|20110101070429.000|CC1|THE SECOND IS ALMOST LIKE A     
20110101070429.000|20110101070432.000|CC1|FAIRY TALE, LIKE SNOW WHITE,    
20110101070432.000|20110101070434.000|CC1|BEAUTIFUL CHARACTERS, BEAUTIFUL 
20110101070434.000|20110101070437.000|CC1|ANIMALS.                        
20110101070437.000|20110101070439.000|CC1|IT IS BEAUTIFUL CARTOONISH      
20110101070439.000|20110101070441.000|CC1|THEME.                          
20110101070441.000|20110101070444.000|CC1|>> YOU MAKE A DIFFICULT PIECE   
20110101070444.000|20110101070447.000|CC1|SOUND LIKE IT IS FUN TO PLAY.   
20110101070447.000|20110101070449.000|CC1|WHICH IS IT FOR YOU, FINE OR    
20110101070449.000|20110101070450.000|CC1|DIFFICULT?                      
20110101070450.000|20110101070454.000|CC1|>> BOTH I WOULD SAY.            
20110101070454.000|20110101070456.000|CC1|IT HAS VERY DIFFICULT PASSAGES, 
20110101070456.000|20110101070459.000|CC1|SUPER HARD OCTAVE, HARD TO MAKE 
20110101070459.000|20110101070505.000|CC1|IT REALLY FIT WITH THE          
20110101070505.000|20110101070506.000|CC1|HARMONIES, BUT IT IS VERY FUN   
20110101070506.000|20110101070508.000|CC1|BECAUSE YOU ENJOY THE MOMENT    
20110101070508.000|20110101070512.000|CC1|PLANO'S DIFFICULT PASSAGES --   
20110101070512.000|20110101070513.000|CC1|PLAYING THOSE DIFFICULT         
20110101070513.000|20110101070517.000|CC1|PASSAGES BECAUSE THEIR          
20110101070517.000|20110101070524.000|CC1|SPECTACULAR ITEMS OR CONCEPTS.  
20110101070524.000|20110101070527.000|CC1|THAT GAVE ME A GREAT JOY TO TAKE
20110101070527.000|20110101070531.000|CC1|THE CHALLENGE AND TO REALLY     
20110101070531.000|20110101070532.000|CC1|OVERCOME.                       
20110101070532.000|20110101070536.000|CC1|>> ALAN GILBERT TOLD US THAT HE 
20110101070536.000|20110101070537.000|CC1|TALK TO YOU ABOUT WHEN YOUR     
20110101070537.000|20110101070539.000|CC1|PLANE WITH A SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA,
20110101070539.000|20110101070543.000|CC1|THIS CONCEPT OF THE BIG BALL.   
20110101070543.000|20110101070546.000|CC1|>> ABSOLUTELY, I HAD A GREAT    
20110101070546.000|20110101070547.000|CC1|PRIVILEGE TO WORK WITH HIM      
20110101070547.000|20110101070551.000|CC1|DURING MY AMERICAN DEBUT.       
20110101070551.000|20110101070554.000|CC1|ON THE 16TH, I AM PLAN WITH THE 
20110101070554.000|20110101070555.000|CC1|BALTIMORE SYMPHONY AND HE WAS   
20110101070555.000|20110101070559.000|CC1|THE GUEST CONDUCTOR.            
20110101070559.000|20110101070601.000|CC1|I LEARNED A LOT FROM HIM AT THE 
20110101070601.000|20110101070604.000|CC1|TIME, JUST STARTING A CAREER.   
20110101070604.000|20110101070607.000|CC1|WE WERE TALKING ABOUT HOW TO    
20110101070607.000|20110101070611.000|CC1|BALANCE BETWEEN SOLOIST AND HOW 
20110101070611.000|20110101070615.000|CC1|TO PLAY DIFFERENT WHEN I PERFORM
20110101070615.000|20110101070616.000|CC1|SOLO AND WITH THE ORCHESTRA.    
20110101070616.000|20110101070618.000|CC1|>> HOW WAS IT DIFFERENT?        
20110101070618.000|20110101070622.000|CC1|>> WHEN YOUR SOLOIST, YOU COULD 
20110101070622.000|20110101070623.000|CC1|RISK A LITTLE MORE TO THE       
20110101070623.000|20110101070625.000|CC1|CHANGES BECAUSE YOU ARE BY      
20110101070625.000|20110101070626.000|CC1|YOURSELF.                       
20110101070626.000|20110101070629.000|CC1|>> YOU SEEM LIKE YOU ARE SOMEONE
20110101070629.000|20110101070633.000|CC1|WHO CHANGES -- WHO ARE FOND OF  
20110101070633.000|20110101070634.000|CC1|TEMPO CHANGES.                  
20110101070634.000|20110101070638.000|CC1|>> RIGHT, NOT CRAZY, BUT I LIKE 
20110101070638.000|20110101070642.000|CC1|TO TAKE SOME CHARACTER CHANGES. 
20110101070642.000|20110101070643.000|CC1|WITH THE ORCHESTRA, YOU NEED TO 
20110101070643.000|20110101070646.000|CC1|BE AWARE, THERE ARE 100         
20110101070646.000|20110101070647.000|CC1|MUSICIANS PLAYING AT THE SAME   
20110101070647.000|20110101070650.000|CC1|TIME WHEN YOU CHANGE SOMETHING. 
20110101070650.000|20110101070654.000|CC1|WE NEED TO WORK AS A TEAM TO    
20110101070654.000|20110101070656.000|CC1|TAKE IT TOGETHER.
